dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Compute pairwise geodesic arcs which connect all input points. These arcs represent the shortest distance (great circle distance) between the locations. An attribute of the distance is also included as an output column, "Distance_in_km".

NOTE: This script is resource intensive, and by default tries to use memory for all of its operations to improve performance. For large datasets (e.g. over 500 points) this script will automatically switch to disk-base operations, which are significantly slower, and in this circumstance the script can take many hours to complete.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by the geneGIS team: Dori Dick, Shaun Walbridge, Scott Baker, Dawn Wright

tool.name: ShortestDistancePaths

param.name: Input_Feature_Class
param.dialogReference: A feature class, containing the point features for creating paths between.

param.name: Output_Feature_Class
param.dialogReference: The result will contain densified geodesic arcs which accurately represent the geodesic path between each pair of points.

param.name: Closest_Count
param.dialogReference: Set this option if you only want to draw lines between each point and its one closest neighbor.
